metadata.Title: CVE-2021-44758 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heimdal before 7.7.1 allows attackers to cause a NULL pointer dereferencein a SPNEGO acceptor via a preferred_mech_type of GSS_C_NO_OID and anonzero initial_response value to send_accept.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44758` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

heimdal-clients - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-kcm - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-kdc - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-multidev - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-servers - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libasn1-8-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libgssapi3-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libhcrypto4-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libhdb9-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libheimbase1-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libheimntlm0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libhx509-5-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libkadm5clnt7-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libkadm5srv8-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libkafs0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libkdc2-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libkrb5-26-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libotp0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libroken18-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libsl0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libwind0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: heimdal package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3').
